channel.title: (317) Disabling items in wild
channel.description: I recently added overloads to my delta server, but couldn't figure out how to disable them in the wild. Help would be much appreciated!

item.title: (317) Disabling items in wild
item.dc:creator: @Lotus_4993 Lotus 4993
item.description:
@Lotus_4993 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:429078”]It probably wasn’t C/P ready. You need to change it to fit your server.

His uses “inWild”, mine uses “player.isInWilderness()”[/quote]

“c.isInWilderness” worked correctly, but I was still able to drink them in the wilderness. Would I have to change it to “isInWilderness” to == true or something?

Spades:

Adding extremes to just take them away in the wilderness is just a tease to your players, don’t you think?

Extremes and overloads on my server are going to be like RS - not allowed in wilderness. PVM only.

Edit: Fixed, close this please.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It probably wasn’t C/P ready. You need to change it to fit your server.

His uses “inWild”, mine uses “player.isInWilderness()”

item.title: (317) Disabling items in wild
item.dc:creator: @Lotus_4993 Lotus 4993
item.description:
@Lotus_4993 wrote:

[quote=“chazion, post:3, topic:429078”]find your method for drinking the overload and add a check for being in the wilderness…

if (inwild) //sendmessage return; [/quote]

Tried it and got this error.

Compiling Root files...

potions.java:1473: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable inwild
location: class potions
if (inwild) {
^
potions.java:1519: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable inwild
location: class potions
if (inwild) {
^
potions.java:1566: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable inwild
location: class potions
if (inwild) {
^
potions.java:1613: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable inwild
location: class potions
if (inwild) {
^
4 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

With my very limited coding capabilities, I’m guessing that it is not understanding what “(inwild)” means? If that’s the case, how do I make it so it can define whether or not a player is in the wilderness or not.

Read full topic

item.title: (317) Disabling items in wild
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

find your method for drinking the overload and add a check for being in the wilderness…

 if (inwild) 
//sendmessage
return;

Read full topic

item.title: (317) Disabling items in wild
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Add a clause to your ItemClick packet.

if (item.getId() == someOverloadId) {
    if (player.isInWilderness()) {
        break;
    }
}

Read full topic
